points.name: Determining What the Therapist can Help You to Achieve

steps.title: Determine what part of your problem can be helped by a therapist.
steps.subtitle: Write a brief (two or three sentences) summary of this using the above steps on what a therapist can and cannot do.
sub-points: Spend some time thinking about what exactly you want help with and what you envision the end result to be.

steps.title: Search online or in the phone book for universities and graduate schools and find those that have graduate programs in Counseling Psychology if on a budget.
steps.subtitle: Many of them will have counseling facilities in order to train their students. The students will be supervised by qualified professionals and teachers.
sub-points: Call up charitable and religious institutions that you are involved with or that you respect. Many of them maintain lists of therapists that may give you a price break.

Some therapists that are not necessarily low-fee may have reduced fee slots available. Ask about the fees. Tell them what you can afford. Some therapists will be able to accommodate you. If they do not, they may know someone who does and can give you a referral.
